website_summaries.verdict: A life jacket that is designed to keep your dog safe and comfortable at all times.
pros: Constructed with dual grab handles for easy rescue and restraint
Bright orange coloring and reflective piping ensure high visibility
A secure neck float helps keep your dog's head above water

customer_reviews.title: Nice Dog PFD for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: It looks durable and made with quality materials. It's also pretty low profile, so it won't be too bulky for your dog. I only saw girth measurements for sizing but I saw weight measurements on the packaging when it arrived that may help you make your decision: XX Small 11-14" Girth, up to 11lbs X Small 15-19", 11-18lbs Small 19-24", 15-25lbs Medium 22-29", 20-50lbs Large 26-35", 40-70lbs X Large 31-42", 70-90lbs
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Great lifejacket! I ordered this for my mini long-haired ...
customer_reviews.text: Great lifejacket! I ordered this for my mini long-haired dachshund, who tries hard but is not a strong swimmer. He's able to stay afloat with this vest (we're still working on keeping his head above water, but the neck piece on this vest helps a lot). We ordered a size small. For reference, he is only 9 pounds (which is in range for size XS), but all of his measurements put him in the Small range. I was worried it would be too big, but he fits (almost) perfectly in the small since the straps cinch him in. It's a little big in the back, but he's still young so he's got room to grow.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Circelli

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Fit!!
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered an XL for my 70 lb Lab based upon user reviews noting the jacket runs small. The XL swallowed my dog so will not fit. I ordered a L, which says up to 85 lbs and it is so small it will not fit my 70 lb dog. The size difference between the two is unbelievable and both are supposed to fit an 85 lb. dog (L up to 85 l S and XL starting at 85 lbs.)
customer_reviews.author: jessiesmom

customer_reviews.title: Bulldog approved
customer_reviews.text: Loved the vest for my bulldog Chubbs. He had ACL surgery and due to the Vegas heat we needed another way for him to get rehabilitation.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Safety First even though your Dog can swim!
customer_reviews.text: My German Shepherd weighs 110 lbs so I got the XL and it fits like a glove! As you can see he's a handsome boy sporting orange! Easy to see if he falls in the Canal or Ocean! I gave him some training in the pool to give him confidence of the jacket. He's a 1 1/2 yrs old and stills chases and plays hard. Jumping onto our boat is a safety precaution and those handles on the back has many purposes! Nice quality too!
customer_reviews.author: Patty PC

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: Our dog loves this life jacket! He can swim without it but just not well or for very long. In the mornings he would try to get into it himself so we would go throw the ball into the lake for him! Medium fit perfectly for our oddly shaped dog. Has different velcro and buckles to change sizes and make it a custom fit!
customer_reviews.author: Jessi

customer_reviews.title: Stitching tore out where the bottom grey velcro belly meets ...
customer_reviews.text: Stitching tore out where the bottom grey velcro belly meets the orange on both sides. This item has been used 3 times.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: My water loving dog can now swim!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We have a border collie mix who absolutely loves going in water, but he would splash around and panic when he got in water that was too deep. I'm so glad I got the one for novice swimmers, he's an athletic and strong dog but none of the others would have been sufficient. He still has absolute terrible form and slaps his front legs on the water, but at least he can float and fetch in the process. This is an amazing doggie vest.
customer_reviews.author: HeatherMT

customer_reviews.title: I think he would have also fit in a Large but it's nice that he has more floats with the XL
customer_reviews.text: We have a 65lb English Bulldog with a 32 inch girth. After reading the reviews we decided to go with the XL. I think he would have also fit in a Large but it's nice that he has more floats with the XL. It is a little bit too long but everything else fits fine. Can't wait to take him out on the lake once it warms up! UPDATE: Vest works great keeping our dog floating on the surface. No issues with wear and tear. Handle on the back makes lifting him back in the boat easier.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D

customer_reviews.title: Well made and works great
customer_reviews.text: I have a 25 pound French Bulldog who swims like a concrete block. This Life Vest worked perfectly for him at our neighbor lake. He was able to enjoy the water and hand out with the kids. He had a blast. It took a little while for him to realize that he was able to swim with it. It fit him perfectly too. It is made of quality material. It has a velcro underside that covers his entire belly and then two straps that click keeping the velcro in place. The top handles really come in handy if you need to pick the dog up.
customer_reviews.author: Mushjet

customer_reviews.title: False Sense of Security
customer_reviews.text: My dog was an excellent swimmer, but getting old and needs some help now. This life jacket states it’s for novice swimmers, so I thought it would help her. Unfortunately, it will not consistently keep her nose above water. I was hoping she could at least float and paddle around a little comfortably, but I still have to hold on and support her every second. Other than that, the quality of materials and construction is good, but just a poor design for novice swimmers or those needing much assistance. It is a slim and well-fitting shape though, so might be good for strong swimmers as it doesn’t restrict movement, but then my strong swimmers never needed a life jacket.
customer_reviews.author: MyDogsDad

customer_reviews.title: Good K9 protection
customer_reviews.text: Fits our Shih Tsu very well. Keeps her afloat although she has a difficult time maintaining her balance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and durable
customer_reviews.text: fits the corgi nicely. i'm quite surprised cause it's usually impossible to find something that fits his length. 3 years going strong and it's still keeping its shape.
customer_reviews.author: Vivian Lee

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous, do not use or buy.
customer_reviews.text: Stretch? Lightweight? Accuracy? I'm not sure how to judge this item on those three suggestion, but I will say I think this is a dangerous safety device. The straps that go around the chest will not stay closed and the the neck float forces my dogs head up so high (when in the water) she can't properly breathe. Additionally, the straps around the chest are too far forward on the dog, meaning if your dog's hind legs start getting lower in the water your dog could easily slip out of the safety device altogether. I would not recommend this at all and think the company should redesign the device.
customer_reviews.author: BestAmazonReviews

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality  - DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what the problem is. We had four Outward Hound vests in this style in the past and they lasted for years. Bought two new ones this summer and both have turned out to be really poor quality. Returned them, got replacements and the same thing is true. Straps come apart, vest tears, neck support tears and floatation support is poor and this is in a swimming pool. I shudder to think what would happen to my dogs in the ocean or a lake if we used it there. Tried a higher end vest from a New England retailer - more money but it didn't fit right. We're still searching.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: Hot Dog of a Life Jacket!
customer_reviews.text: As new boat owners, we needed a flotation device for our mini dachshund that is used to her freedom. The fit is perfect, she seems comfortable and secure wearing it, and I can easily carry her by holding the center handle. Fortunately she hasn't fallen into the water to test it further!
customer_reviews.author: Karann

customer_reviews.title: Great Nuetral Buoyancy For Experienced Swimmers
customer_reviews.text: This is an experienced swimmer life jacket, and is superb at the task. There are three types of buoyancy: positive (floats on the surface of the water) negative (sinks) and neutral (floats just at the water line). This vest brings an animal from negative, to neutral buoyancy. This makes swimming EASIER... not easy. The straps are made to be adjusted every time; fit should be a tad tighter than most folks might think it needs to be. This vest is NOT a survival device, and should not be used for doggos that are not able swimmers.
customer_reviews.author: Bad Man

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Control and Defective Stitching
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this several months ago and only just recently used it for the first time. Unfortunately, in four separate places, including the straps that secure across the stomach, the stitching is unraveling and the straps are coming loose! Definitely do not feel comfortable putting my dog in this vest. I’m well past the Amazon return period (my fault) but I thought maybe if I reached out to the manufacturer directly they could exchange it for me. They refused. Pretty disappointed that they do not stand behind their product. Will purchase another vest from a different manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Corvette

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Chaffing
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased all 3 of the life jackets Outward Hound offers , the red one is by far the best one with the way it fits our dog. This blue and green one goes from the chest between the legs to belly and it causes SEVERE chaffing on my dog. She's 5 years old and has never had this happen before with any harness or life jacket, be careful. In the mean time I'll go back to the red one that connects across the chest and down around the belly instead.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Williams

customer_reviews.title: Size selections of XS, S, M, L, XL and only this.
customer_reviews.text: I did not like all the many measurement selection size selections. Because of them I ended up ordering a size too small for my dog. I measured my dog and used them to place the order based on them which equaled a XS size. And normally I would have ordered a size S (small), And if you had only had the selections of XS. S, M, L, then I would have selected a size S and I know that it would have fit. But now I am so upset that I missed out on the Prime sale day discount and extra reward points bonus that I am not going to reorder it just because of selections you.
customer_reviews.author: Abbie sdsg

customer_reviews.title: S is too small and M is too big
customer_reviews.text: After realizing the S was too small, I ordered the M, and had to double check I ordered the right size beacause it was SO much bigger than the S, far too big for my dog. He is a 20lbs cocker spaniel and the S barely fit on him at the loosest setting and the M barely stayed on him at the tightest. A size in between is needed OR better sizing adjustment features..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dog tested, dog approved!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best life jackets out there! This works great for my 60lb bulldog!!! If anyone knows bulldogs, most of them can not swim because they are very top heavy! One of the best things about this life jacket is the neck floatie. It holds my bulldogs head up while he swims so his head doesn't end up tipping into the water. (yes, that does happen) The handles on this are life savers too! I can pick my 60lb bully up out of the water just fine by using just these handles. Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah

customer_reviews.title: BEST VEST. PERFECT ALSO FOR SMALL/TINY DOGS!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was hoping for. This is far different from those less expensive, bulky vests that you see more commonly. I wanted a vest that my 14 year old 8lbs Brussels Griffon can wear by our pool, God forbid she falls in when I am not watching - hence it needed to fit great and be comfortable. I have not tried it in water but I will update this review ONLY if it does NOT continue to deliver per my high expectations. So far this is a great buy. The perfect best, even for our tiny dogs without being swallowed up by the vest!
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Awful fit for my dog
customer_reviews.text: Was so excited to receive this for my dog (90lbs GSD) to join me kayaking UNTIL I went to fit the vest to her size and asked her to sit. She refused. I knew something was wrong when she reluctantly sat I saw that the placement to the buckle was right where her knee/belly meet in a seated position. She needs to sit in a kayak so had to be returned. Baffled why this would be made like this but Gateful I could return. Got a Ruff wear vest and very happy w the fit.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey K

customer_reviews.title: Great to give a little buoyancy
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a strong swimmer who's in water almost every day, but I got this for taking him rafting and boating. I wanted a jacket that would give him a little extra buoyancy as he swam around so he wouldn't get too tired, and as an emergency life jacket just in case of a boating accident. It worked perfectly. He's very tall and long, but pretty skinny (~90 lbs), and I got him an XL. It fit perfectly and was adjustable in many different ways. He didn't mind having it on, so it must have been relatively comfortable. He swam off and on for hours and never got too exhausted. I'm very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Emily A.

customer_reviews.title: A Little Big on My Shepsky
customer_reviews.text: Got the XL for my 85lb German Shepherd/Husky mix and it is a touch too big, but still works pretty well. Only reason I say it is a little too big is the overlap on the velcro, but the straps still buckle in and it is still secure on my dog. Used this for his first swimming experience, and while he was nervous about not touching the bottom, this life jacket was great and definitely a boost to his confidence. Would definitely recommend. If you are on the edge/in between 2 sizes, I would recommend going with the smaller as there is some decent stretch to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Karate

customer_reviews.title: Great Lifesaving Vest
customer_reviews.text: Our 20 lb Havanese wears a small and it fits snug. On the first day he used it, he fell in the water and popped right up and floated. I grabbed the handle and lifted him out of the water. This vest works as described. I would recommend it for your dog if you are a water active owner.
customer_reviews.author: racktown

customer_reviews.title: RIPPED right away!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my lab who fit the size guideline of a large. When we received it we thought it seems a little tight but we were able to Velcro and secure the clasps and assumed is was snug for safety purposes. He has used it 3 times and shows confidence in the jacket. I was excited about the product but while swimming the 3rd time the material ripped. Really disappointed in the sizing and quality of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Mumau

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive advertising.
customer_reviews.text: Product said for dog or cat up to 15 pounds. My cat is 10.8 pounds. It clearly does not go around his belly. So the floatation jacket should fit my cat and does not. The straps were drawn all the way to the buckle and will not clip shut without pinching..too tight. Plus it is so tight it gathers and pinches against his arm pits in front. Clearly the product does not fit the cat comfortably and does not accomodate the weight that it promises.
customer_reviews.author: cynthia gabriel

customer_reviews.title: This item fits and looks just like the package
customer_reviews.text: This item fits and looks just like the package. It arrived very early too. The adjustable straps have a velcro locking system that has worked great for extra tightening on my #6 dog. I have returned 2 others either because they would not tighten enough. The other really important feature is the extra piece under the chin to help keep her head up. I tried a jacket without this feature and returned it after being in the water with her. She needs the extra support to keep her from swallowing water. This jacket is by far the best out of the 3 others I have tried.
customer_reviews.author: amama2all3

customer_reviews.title: Straps will not stay tight, worthless item
customer_reviews.text: Once I tightened the straps and put the jacket on my dog, he leapt into the water.....the straps loosened, the jacket spun and the whole effect was worthless. I am sorely disappointed, especially after reading the great reviews. It is as though I received a totally different product! I am returning it, even though it has been used.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Runs a little big
customer_reviews.text: My little dude is a long-haired dachshund, about 17 pounds. I read the reviews, followed the measurement instructions and ordered a medium. The fit is not awful, but it's a little big and the little chin shelf thing seemed to bug my pup. Those two things combined meant it kept him afloat, but swimming was pretty much out of the question. Could be that my dog is just an in-between size for this product--I think a small would probably be too small. That said, I bought it to keep him safe when we're on the boat, because one bump and he'd go flying. I think it'll be fine for that purpose, and he looks awfully dang cute in it!
customer_reviews.author: Dorkahontas

customer_reviews.title: If you want to drown your dogs this item is for you! *sarcasm*
customer_reviews.text: Hugeee waste of money. I paid $17.98 a piece six months ago and almost drowned both my dachshunds. The only way these work is if you literally hold the dogs up so they don’t flip in head first and drown. Really dangerous product!
customer_reviews.author: booka90

customer_reviews.title: It was horrible I wouldn’t recommend this life jacket to anyone ever
customer_reviews.text: I would give it no stars if possible! I purchased this for my 80lb pit and it didn’t work at all. My dog tried to follow me out into the lake and he was frantically trying to swim and couldn’t stay above water. It was horrible I wouldn’t recommend this life jacket to anyone ever!
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Happy Dog. Happy owner.
customer_reviews.text: We have a Jack Russell Terrier who likes to join us on adventures but we wanted him to be safe (he's family after all). This jacket is awesome. The jacket velcros completely around his belly. The added straps around it ensure it wont come open. The handles on top prove very useful every time he jumps in for a swim but cant get back into the kayak. We just grab him and lift him easily back in. The stitching is tight so I dont worry about anything coming undone. The bright color ensures I can't lose sight of him. Most importanly, it works! He leaps in the water and pops right back up.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Magillicutti

customer_reviews.title: Helped my dog learn to swim
customer_reviews.text: I have a 90lbs chocolate lab who loves the water but did not know how to swim (he swam vertically rather than horizontally with the water). This has really helped him learn how to swim horizontally with the water. I ended up buying a second one for my golden retriever who is naturally a stellar swimmer, but I bought it for him for piece of him, and hopefully so he can swim for longer without getting tired out!
customer_reviews.author: Rush

customer_reviews.title: The sizing is true, so if your dog falls at a half-size, opt for the smaller size-size,
customer_reviews.text: We were advised to have water therapy to treat am ACL injury our dog incurred. Keeping him supported was an issue- this product met all requirements! We could support his torso, but he panicked when his hips sagged. Multiple straps and braces were overkill, so this item seemed the perfect solution; it does all we need to keep him afloat without the distraction of all the extra support lines.
customer_reviews.author: J R TANNISH

customer_reviews.title: Warning: extremely dangerous product. Handle broke off on first use.
customer_reviews.text: Warning: extremely dangerous product. Handle broke off on first use. Lucky dog was not in the water or we may have lost him...
customer_reviews.author: Clinton Cimring

customer_reviews.title: Sizing on Amazon is not even close to correct - too small
customer_reviews.text: I used the sizing chart on Amazon and measured my dog to select the correct size. The vest I received wasn't even close to the measured size. As others have said in their reviews the sizing for these vests runs very small. Don't trust the sizing chart for the product on Amazon. I wish I read the reviews before ordering. Returned for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Dog Tested and Approved!
customer_reviews.text: Used this for my dog’s first time kayaking. As I expected, she jumped out of the kayak within the first five minutes. Her head dunked under from the sheer force of her jump, but this awesome life jacked brought her right back up. This definitely eases this doggy mommy’s heart, since I have a very happy, fun-loving, slightly wild girl! The small will fit a dog that weighs 15 pounds, but we had to completely expand all of the straps. A medium probably would have been too large for her. Good range of motion. I was worried it might suck the fun out of the trip for my dog, but it didn’t seem to faze her.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Complete waste of money
customer_reviews.text: We bought this jacket in August of 2015 for our 65lb dog. It has been used on weekends only during warm weather, which means that by early July of 2016, it has accumulated a bit less than 3 months of weekend use. The seams on the life jacket have failed and it is coming apart. I contacted the vendor who said that it has a 30-day warranty. They did, however offer me 20% off a purchase at their website Why on earth would I buy another life jacket that has but a 3-month life span. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Navy

customer_reviews.title: A true life saver
customer_reviews.text: Turns out our graceful land missile 'Moose' was not quite as graceful during his forays as a 1st time swimmer. Did not come naturally to him. Fearless. Lept right in. But not graceful. So.. We began our search for something to help us help him. We did our research. Read many reviews and decided on this one. We don't regret it for a second. Our guy is 110 lbs. Lean, solid, long, and tall. XL fits him perfectly. Thinks it's his Superman cape. It has helped immensely at keeping him safe and bouyant in the water and has been very useful in helping him develop his swimming skills.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Sizes run small - Beginner
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of the beginner style for my 12-13 lb Yorkies. They were NOT happy about wearing these, which was hilarious. Great for pictures though. They did get better and moved around more after a while. They work great as far as we could tell in the pool, I do assume my dogs will float in them. The size chart is off, at least for my dogs. They would fit under XS for weight, but they are both Small for girth. Little annoying, but just took a return and second order. Problem solved!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Saint

customer_reviews.title: Get the next size bigger!
customer_reviews.text: I returned the size that was recommended for my pup and ordered the next size up. I took all the measurements suggested, and he was right in the middle of the suggested weight, but the next-larger size ended-up fitting much better. We take our dog kayaking all the time, and he sometimes gets bored and just jumps off the boat! Not only does this add buoyancy, but the handles on the back are perfect for hauling him back up on deck. Quality seems great so far with no tearing or wear after a few dozen trips. I'd buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Well made dog life jacket.
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made product. It is hard to get the correct fit. It all fits my 10 lb. Coton except the neck. For him the neck is not large enough so the flap that should be under his chin is to the side. When we went into the pool his face would go under water, not good at all. I still think it is a good product, it just doesn’t fit my dog right. Really, really measure your dog. I did a quick try on and thought it fit correctly. Weeks later when we actually used it I found it didn’t and at that point I couldn’t return it.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this one unless your dog is the max size for the vest
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a joke. Unless your dog is the max size for it, it won't work. The straps are allegedly adjustable via velcro adjustors. However, as soon as you put the dog in the vest and there is any pressure at all against the straps, they totally pull out to their full length. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: kristilynnp23

customer_reviews.title: XS fit my 8lb Yorkie with room to spare
customer_reviews.text: This fits my 8lb yorkie perfectly. She’s very comfortable in it. There’s a handle but it’s not super padded underneath so I try not to use the handle much. It’s completely adjustable so it could actually fit a Slightly larger dog than mine. My sister-in-law has a 5lb yorkie and it would NOT fit her. I don’t think I would buy this for a really tiny dog. It does not have a loop for the leash and the handle is too thick to hook the leash on. Seems like this design is better for larger dogs, but overall I’m pleased.
customer_reviews.author: T. Stiller

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I bought the medium for our "tweeny" dachshund as he is a bit larger than a true miniature, weighing in at 16 lbs. It requires a bit of adjusting to get it just right, but fits nicely when done. It seems well made, and it keeps my dog's head out of the water. The neck is a bit large for a tweeny, but can be tightened. The chest is just right. I am very pleased and would recommend this vest.
customer_reviews.author: CPLAZ

customer_reviews.title: May have saved our dog!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for riding our SUPs down the river with my daughter's small dog. We encountered a couple of unanticipated obstacles that threw our daughter and her little dog into the current. She grabbed the handle and put her back on the board and then got back on herself. The jacket helped her float and made her easy to see and grab. She weighs about 8 lbs and we got the XS. She fit fine, but there wasn't much room around her chest and neck. If your dog is much bigger, I'd size up as you can cinch down.
customer_reviews.author: Grizman

customer_reviews.title: If I fits, I ships
customer_reviews.text: It fits! Hard to find a vest that will comfortable fit a fluffy Bernese Mountain Dog. They do say on the vest that it's up to 100 lb, and I hadn't seen a weight limit on the listing.. But I'm going to hope it's good for larger than that as my guy is 120. There's enough room to tighten the vest, which has never happened with any life vest I've tried with him before. All around fairly satisfied, just hoping the weight limit is a lie. It did come with some dirt marks as well but doesn't look used, whatever, it'll be much dirtier soon.
customer_reviews.author: Ange

customer_reviews.title: Life savor
customer_reviews.text: My dog was terrified of the life jacket the first couple of times we put it on. Once he realize that he uses it only when he gets in the water, he loved it! He actually prefers we put his life jacket on him now before getting into the water. We allow him to get into Ohio River, which can be very dangerous if the current is going fast. We tied a robe onto the top handle of the life jacket so he does not float away and it worked great! He is a labradoodle and weighs roughly 65+ pounds. We purchased the XL and I am so happy we did. Fits perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Sizing a little off, but great quality life vests!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two larges for my 50 pound goldendoodle and 70-75 pound labradoodle. It fit perfectly on my goldendoodle, but the XL definitely would've been better for my labradoodle. It is pretty snug and the part that velcros around the stomach was way too small, therefore it wouldn't velcro, but I kept it anyway because we were going canoeing that day and besides the velcro, the straps fit fine since they are adjustable. It fit pretty perfectly on my 50 pound dog, with the straps all the way tightended. A medium may have worked, but I'm glad I got the large so I didn't run into the same problem I had with my 75 pound dog.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish it lasted longer than a handful of wears.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this life jacket for our sheepdog because he's not the best swimmer. We've had it a little over a year, but have only used it a handful of times- saying we used it 5 times might be an exaggeration. We pulled it out for it's first use this year and both handles on the top broke within minutes of putting it on. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: JLK1020

customer_reviews.title: Great price. Glad we had it
customer_reviews.text: 80lb lab. XL size jacket. Glad to have had this at the lake. The rescue handles are great. My complaint is that unless you make it very tight around the dog, if they actually get in the water to swim, water collects like a pouch in it under their belly, weighing them down. If you will be using for accidental fall in water for the dog, it will float them for life preservation, but may not be best for swimming. This is our first experience with a life jacket for a dog, so that may be common.
customer_reviews.author: tpdds

customer_reviews.title: We ordered an X-Large in this style and in the ...
customer_reviews.text: We ordered an X-Large in this style and in the Granby style for our larger dog (100lbs and 40" in girth) and both fit perfectly. He is muscular, and this style gave him a bit more mobility in the torso, so we returned the Granby one. He's a strong swimmer, so it was more for if there was an emergency. For our smaller dog, (20lbs and 20" in girth), we order both the small and the medium in both this style and the Granby style. In both of the styles, the small was just slightly too small and the medium was waaayyy too big. We ended up returning both of the life jackets we bought for her.
customer_reviews.author: Tess

customer_reviews.title: Great durability and secure comfort
customer_reviews.text: I have a 70lb golden retriever 6 month old puppy that this fits perfectly. He is very slender and tall so the Large fit him with plenty of room for his chest to grow bigger. It is very durable. He jumped from our boat in to the middle of the lake and needed lifted back in, the handles held up great. The color is very bright and needed when you have anyone overboard. The front and chest area are velcro and reinforced by snap buckle to secure a tight fit. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality materials, Everything fit well except the neck
customer_reviews.text: This PFD fit my 7lb Chihuahua perfectly in length and around his body. However, the neck strap was way too small. Consequently, even when extended to it's maximum, I can't fasten the neck strap. I'm probably going to cut off the neck strap and replace it with my own piece of velcro that I can cut to a length that fits my dog's neck. The overall quality of the materials and construction seems very good. An improvement would be to add a "D" ring for attaching a leash. This would be quite handy when walking on docks to and from the boat.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Good but too size specific
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely a CUTE life jacket for dogs, but the sizing is so specific it was hard to tell how well it works. My dog is a Labernese and he was only 3.5 months old when we got this for him. He’s now 5.5 months old and there’s no way he can fit his medium size jacket anymore. He could barely fit it that day! We didn’t want to take his harness off from underneath but had to to make it work. Make sure if you have a growing puppy you get a used one... they grow too fast!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah A

customer_reviews.title: Large fits my 62 lb lab perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this life jacket for our furry baby since she loves the water and we were planning a Lakehouse trip. Spent about five days at the lake. She wasn't crazy about it initially, but she got used to it fairly quickly. It fits her perfectly and securely, and she has great range of motion in it. She's a 62 pound, deep chested lab, and the large fit really well. Quality seems good and I like the bright color. Light-weight and easy to put on. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Afemat

customer_reviews.title: Helped save my dog!
customer_reviews.text: I took my 53lb pitbull on a float trip and this was her first time in the water. We tipped and got caught up in a strong current. I was able to grab her by the handle and the vest kept her afloat easily while we got back to land. It stayed on, stayed clasped, stayed together. I had to tighten it a bit afterwards b/c of how hard the current pulled, but it was fantastic. I was anxious at first b/c of the inexpensive price but glad that I went with the positive reviews instead.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hopson

customer_reviews.title: MADE WELL, BUT SINGLE HANDLE VERY FLIMSILY ATTACHED
customer_reviews.text: THEY BURIED THIS IN THE FINE PRINT, ABOUT THE SMALL SIZE JUST HAVING ONE HANDLE. THAT WOULDN'T BE SO BAD, BUT THEY ATTACHED IT TO THE THIN TOP LAYER OF THE ORANGE MATERIAL INSTEAD OF ONE OF THE BLACK STRAPS LIKE IN THE PICTURE. LOOKS LIKE I WOULD RIP THE FIRST TIME YOU PUT ANY WEIGHT ON IT. 2 DAYS LATER AND IT HASN'T RIPPED YET. i USE IT SEVERAL TIMES A DAY TO TAKE MY 14 LBS OLD DOG OUTSIDE , BECAUSE HE CAN'T WALK WELL ANYMORE. MIGHT REINFORCE IT. OTHERWISE IT'S REALLY STURDY. THE HANDLE RUINS THE WHOLE DESIGN.
customer_reviews.author: Imjusttellinthetruth

customer_reviews.title: good fit
customer_reviews.text: This appears to be very well made! Its got good adjustability for fit and nice color, stitching, handles, velcro etc. I took my dog to river to swim for the first and she did well and loved it but seemed to tire out and not realize it until in deep water/currents so this will help keep her safer and help my piece of mind. I haven't used it yet but I can tell it will work as advertised. Will update review if anything changes. She weighs about 40-45 lb all muscle.
customer_reviews.author: Librarygirl

customer_reviews.title: Well made and the sizing chart is totally correct
customer_reviews.text: Obviously she's not too happy with it (note the tail curled under) at the moment but it's the first time I put it on her. But it fits her perfectly with adjustments possible in a very easy way. She's a Havanese and her girth was 17 1/2 in. She weighs around 13 lb. So another words the sizing chart is accurate. I don't think she could have handled the next size up and definitely not the lower size. I wish it laid a little flatter towards her tail. But overall I like it and it's a good fit. I may put it on her at different times to get her used to it before we go out onto a boat.
customer_reviews.author: F. Rinehart

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Helper
customer_reviews.text: Bought the small size , my chihuahua-corgi weighs about 8 - 10 pounds or so . Fit pretty well , didn’t flip her over or make her go under . Never have taken her in oceans or anything before outside of baths , so I’m overall glad I found this . I could trust her in the water and not worry about her drowning , just always watch your pets in it , the handle on top of the vest is also very helpful . No seams ripping , feels sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Adah Edwards

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves her new vest
customer_reviews.text: This fits great on our 17 lb Chi-weenie (part chihuahua, part dachshund). She loves to wear this in the boat and on the dock. The handle on the back is great for grabbing her and pulling her onto the boat or in the water. The only minor complaint I have is that I wish it had a better place to hook on her leash. We hook it around something, but there's not a ring sewn on specifically for that. Other than that, it's working great!
customer_reviews.author: Reader124

customer_reviews.title: Great life jacket for boat dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Fits my dog great! She loves to wade in the water from the shoreline, but she’s a little nervous to get in deep water off of the boat. The life jacket has been great for letting her swim in deep water without getting too tired or panicking. She just floats around and doesn’t try to climb up/drown the people in the water around her when she has the life jacket on. The handles on top are a great feature. You can just reach down and lift her up onto the boat by the handles. Recommend for anyone who takes their dog out on a boat or swimming in deep water!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really sturdy and well lined
customer_reviews.text: This thing will definately help my dog float. I bought this for my female Siberian husky, normal female height and length, but she's girthy and weighs a solid 55 pounds. I bought the large and it fits her perfectly. She hated trying it on, but I'm hoping once she gets in the water she'll forgive me. She's afraid of heights and the feeling of not having her feet touch solid ground, but she recently discovered that docks are made to go into deeper water by walking off the deepest point and sinking for a good couple of seconds. Now she can make the same mistake twice without sinking at least.
customer_reviews.author: Skc

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: This jacket works great for our goldendoodle. It's not bulky and easy to see. It is very adjustable.It is very bright and beautiful. The greatest feature is the nicely placed grab handle which works like a charm lifting our dog out of the lake and up to the dock. I will definitely buy this again for my next dog. I had researched the top 10 dog live jackets and chose this for the non bulky fit that has great flotation. So happy with fit and quality!
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality! Worth the buy!
customer_reviews.text: I am so excited about this!! I recently got a paddle board and of course want my best buddy with me! He is a 41lb basset hound and it fits him great. If he were any smaller it would be too large as I have pulled all of the adjustable straps to the smallest they go. But good news is it’ll fit him as he grows because he’s only a year old. Seems to be sturdy and well built with good material! Can’t wait to put it to the test come summer time! Update: we finally got out to the lake, and this life jacket is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: monica

customer_reviews.title: Jax approves!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 35lb aussie and anytime I would put a life jacket on him, he would stand frozen in place. The one I had for him was a little too bulky so when I came across this life jacket I decided to try it. I'm so happy I did because he doesn't mind it whatsoever. It's not bulky at all and he swims just fine in it! Here's a picture of him right after he went swimming and had the MAJOR zoomies!
customer_reviews.author: TQUINN21

customer_reviews.title: Sizing: Guessing Isn’t a Schnorkie’s Friend
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my ball/water obsessed Schnorkie. After 20 minutes in the water, I noticed it had rubbed his inner thigh raw. The Schnorkie is about 24 lbs with a broad rib cage, so I purchased a medium. This was too big. I will downsize which should also help with the bulky fit around his neck. Otherwise, the quality and design are superb. *Don’t be fooled by his look in the pic. The Schnorkie has RBF. He loved the security the best provided.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal

customer_reviews.title: Good jacket, sizing is a little off
customer_reviews.text: Well made life jacket, however had issues deciding on the size to get my dog. He's an 80 pound chocolate lab with a barrel chest, so technically a large is supposed to fit. Bought a large and I could barely get the Velcro attached underneath him, the length and neck fit well though. Decided to return and go with the XL. The chest strap fits much better, but the neck is a little big. I am able to adjust it tight enough so he won't slip out of it though. All in all, good life jacket just a little hard to get an accurate size.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie Beauford

customer_reviews.title: Too early to tell if the dog will ever like the vest
customer_reviews.text: This review is written by Jack's wife, Dianne: The vest fits well. I like the way the straps and buckles are fashioned. The vest doesn't keep the dog at the top of water, but it does keep the dog from sinking. The only disappointing part is that our dog's chin is not kept out of the water because the chin "ledge" is very small, so she tends to drink the pool water in a panic. I might have to buy a separate floating ring to go around her neck and keep her chin up.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Zalewski

customer_reviews.title: doesn't slow him down at all!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Malinois, who swims a LOT. He suffers from occasional seizures and I worried it might happen while he's way out in the lake to keep him afloat in the event he struggles, I would be able to rescue him. He's been swimming for years, but wearing this doesn't seem to bother him in any way. Size Large seems to fit him, he weighs 75-lbs. I can only hope it keeps him afloat, if a seizure were to happen in the water.
customer_reviews.author: Barb Schommer

customer_reviews.title: Runs large enough to accommodate 120-150 pound mastiff!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased 2 of these for our family's mastiffs. The younger girl, is a svelte 120 pounds and looks completely dashing in her jacket. The older girl has experienced a little middle age spread, and at 150 pounds, is probably close to the jacket's capacity. Good range of motion, enough buoyancy to aid with swimming (even for the heavier dog), and an extra flap to help keep that ginormous head up and out of the water.
customer_reviews.author: 4dabirds

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT Life Vest for our dog Medium for 25lb Pup
customer_reviews.text: We bought this vest for our 25 pound Cavapoo in a size medium to be safe by and play in our pool. IT IS PERFECT! He runs and plays around the pool with ease! It was so easy to put on and the I feel secure that it will not accidentally come loose or fail him due to design. The floatation piece under his neck really helps keep his head easily above water when he's swimming and doesn't interfere when he's playing outside the pool. For this new puppy mama, I feel so much better knowing he is safe and secure!
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Great if you get the right size!
customer_reviews.text: This has great buckles and velcro to secure it, and our dog is comfortable in it. But we ordered the wrong size first. Don't go by the photo of the different dogs wearing different sizes. We saw the Yorkie pic and thought we needed an XS for our Pomeranian/terrier mix, but we needed a Small. Maybe we would have gotten the proper size right off the bat by measuring our dog's girth as one of the other sizing photos suggests.
customer_reviews.author: Amy B

customer_reviews.title: floats, easy to put on my dog, no leash hook up
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this and sometimes I let her sleep in it. it does not seem to cause any rashes on her skin. I don't have a collar on my dog, she wears a harness. there is no place to hook a leash, so I just hook it to one of the handles. other than that...it keeps my dog floating and is easy to put on her. My dog is a Staffordshire terrier. Her girth is approximately 30 inches and weighs 60 pounds. The neck strap is at full length. The chest straps have abiut 3 inches left of each side. So i can expand another 6 inches if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Khaos

customer_reviews.title: Cute/ decent, but beware if your dog is a chonk, stocky, or 'all chest' (Pug, Shih Tzu, etc.)
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this for our dog- I ordered the small (the length of the jacket was perfect, med would have been too long) for my Shih Tzu... but the underbelly straps were just too tight. It still works, and we used it, but I had to leave the first underbelly buckle undone. The flap that goes over the neck buckle was a perfect touch, too, and kept things comfy for him. Overall, though, this was a solid little life jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Lp

customer_reviews.title: Very good product, description = product and more
customer_reviews.text: This was the first time I was buying a life vest for my 85lb dog. I actually purchased 2 because I wasn't sure about the size. It was so easy to slip on and adjust. I wasn't sure what my dog's reaction would be but as you can see in the pictures, she did not mind it a bit even when we were on a boat for 8 hours. She was in the water for 5 days with this life vest on and could not care less about having something around. I highly recommend this product. Very satisfied. Nala approved :)
customer_reviews.author: Marie-Lynne Plante

customer_reviews.title: Go Big or Go Home
customer_reviews.text: We at first bought the Large size for our golden retriever because she was just under the weight max on the recommendations table, and her chest measurements were within the Large range. Boy was that a mistake. The Large cinches were too small to even clip into place. The chest pieces' velcro barely closed. She looked so sad in the Large. We then ordered the Extra Large and it fits perfectly. There is a very noticeable size difference between the Large and the Extra Large. If your dog is much bigger than our golden, then I couldn't say that even the Extra Large would fit. See the pictures for more details (no pics of dog in the extra large).
customer_reviews.author: Jonna T.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my puppy safe
customer_reviews.text: Reasonable price for an interim float vest that our puppy will grow out of. And it works very well. Not restrictive and it helped keep our 10 week old border collie (who is already jumping into the pool) safe in the water. She is an enthusiastic swimmer (now 16 weeks old) who is not yet strong enough to keep her rear end floating. Without the vest she goes vertical when she tries to turn and starts sinking. Nice amount of adjustment too. I expect her to be able to wear this size until she is 7 months or so, then I"ll buy another size and have this one for our next puppy!
customer_reviews.author: k9resqr

customer_reviews.title: Check the clips and stitching regularly - lifejacket came apart in spots
customer_reviews.text: The vest made it almost two summers, then I noticed the straps felt a bit 'brittle', and not long after one of them fell apart. It was used only in our backyard pool which is solely for the dog's use and is only very lightly chlorinated. I would hate for this to happen in an emergency situation so be vigilant, check the vest regularly for weak points, and don't get comfortable relying on it.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Wish they had sizes listed when buying. We bought medium for my 20 lb cockapoo. We thought it was too big so we ordered the small. Medium was the better size you just had to work a little to get the straps smaller. It then fit perfectly covering her back. Worked great kayaking as she did jump out of the kayak to get to someone else but she was easy to see and grab out of the water.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Cote

customer_reviews.title: Dock Dog Saver
customer_reviews.text: Our senior dog loves to jump off of the dock to chase the seagull and ducks when we go to our rental house at the beach. The back bay current runs quickly through there and thank goodness for this great life vest that helps to keep her afloat while she makes her way back to the dock. The vest is durable, fits nicely, the color is bright and vivid so you can easily see it and we love the handles so you can grab your dog and assist them out of the water. We need to order another one for the dog we are getting ready to rescue from the shelter. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is way off
customer_reviews.text: Medium Barely fit my 35pound beagle mix, 24 inch girth at largest part of chest. The body of the life vest measured 25 inches from one end of velcro to the other, the neoprene itself is a few inches longer. The velcro gripped under her belly but not her chest. The straps did wrap around with extra length. The chest piece did not fit flat across her chest, and if you have to loosen it, the chin flap will not be in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: Milspse28

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket!
customer_reviews.text: This life jacket works perfectly for my pup and has every feature I was looking for! He seems comfortable in it, it offers great support, and still allows for great movement. I also like the handles on the top of the vest to easily pull your pup out of the water if necessary. My one recommendation: when measuring my dog he was on the highest end of measurements for the small sized vest, and when it arrived it just barely wasn’t big enough. So when ordering, If your pup is borderline in size order one size bigger!! We mailed back and ordered a medium instead :)
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Holt

customer_reviews.title: Dogs loved it
customer_reviews.text: I liked that my border collie did not seem to even notice it was there. We play a lot of ball in the water, so I wanted something to help take the weight off because she will literally go until she dies! I bought a Medium and it fits well. I put it on her dry, then after a few runs in and out I’ll adjust it bc of how fluffy she is. I have another Medium for my red heeler hoping she’d be more willing to go out past her chest... we’re still working on that haha. They are both 3 for reference and approximately 30-35 pounds
customer_reviews.author: Wise One

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit and works great
customer_reviews.text: We have a beefy little bully put who loves to swim, we have discovered. We recently bought a canoe and got this life vest just in case. Freddy jumped out of the canoe twice in deep water while wearing this life vest and it worked perfectly. The handles made it easier to pull him back into the boat. And the floating flap on the front helped keep his head above water. Great buy so far.
customer_reviews.author: katie naas

customer_reviews.title: Good fit for a 75 lb dog
customer_reviews.text: We bought an XL and it arrived last night after some delays. We had to let the body straps almost all the way out to make it fit over her chest area (behind the front legs) but it does fit. She's a little uncomfortable with it on for the first time but we think she'll get used to it once we get her on the boat. Haven't tried it in the water yet but she's a dog and it looks like it will work great.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Really wanted to love this😕
customer_reviews.text: Omg this is soooo cute!!! We bought this for our 13 lb Jack Russell Papillon mix and the size small fits him great! I will add to my review after we have a chance to try it out on his first river trip next weekend. Well, I wanted to love this but after one weekend river trip I came home and realized that the seems we’re already coming apart. It’s not because of the fit, it worked great keeping our pup afloat, but I would say poor quality stitching. Wish I would’ve just bought a more expensive brand, now I’ll have to either buy new or try to repair this myself. 😕
customer_reviews.author: Krystahl N. Beshears

customer_reviews.title: Durable, sturdy,
customer_reviews.text: This "float coat" is very durable and made well. Our Golden puppy swims well, but his Golden brother tends to try to wrestle and dunk him in the pool. This coat ensures that he comes up quickly :) It is made of durable rip stop fabric and we have now had two this summer. Just purchased the large one for him, because he is growing. I would recumbent Outward Hound and have done so with friends who have swimming dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Amy C. Scriever

customer_reviews.title: Measure before you purchase = perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: I only bought one because I wasn’t sure how our new puppies would actually do in the pool. The most amazing thing was size I was able to fit 3 very different size dogs in a medium. One dog is tiny about 9lbs skin and bones (he is also 16 y.o.), the next is very lean and slender 18lbs and the last one is a huge 35 lbs (very muscular and tall) and the medium size fit them all perfectly. I did measure them all before buying to make sure I was getting the correct fit. This also helped me figure out who can swim and who can’t.
customer_reviews.author: xTaniax

customer_reviews.title: BUY this life vest for your pup!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves to swim but he is a 65lb pitty that is solid muscle, so although he can keep his head above water he has no buoyancy and his body sinks. Swimming without a life vest gets water into his ears and he gets tired too easily but doesn't know when to stop. This life vest gives me peace of mind know he can keep his head above water and have the support he needs. Easily adjustable and nice quality. Great buy for the price. I have not tried to pick him up by the handle yet, something tells me that won't hold more than a time or two after using, for larger dogs anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Swim vest
customer_reviews.text: Product fits well as I purchased xl as my lab has a 35 inch chest and it worked well but the quality is very poor as my dog is a 73 pound yellow lab who now has some joint pain and needs to feel protected when swimming as she isn’t as strong a swimmer as she used to be. We used it once and the stitching is already coming out. It will not last long for a larger more muscular dog. I will return this and purchase another one that is higher quality and probably more expensive as my dog did really enjoy our pool with wearing the dog life/swim vest.
customer_reviews.author: Cally22

customer_reviews.title: Very very good doggy life J
customer_reviews.text: My 125 # Lab/ German shepherd Loves the water .after an episode of ducks in the center of the lake scared me to death I decided no more worry and purchased a xlg vest .I am totally satisfied the release clasps are excellent and the flotation is enough that I dont fear my baby is gonna drown if she gets in a "oops I swam to far " predicament again .
customer_reviews.author: HA Shevak

customer_reviews.title: My dog wearing Outward Hound Kyjen Ripstop Dog Life Jacket
customer_reviews.text: Great life jacket, especially for the price. Was going to buy a jacket for $80, but decided to try the cheaper one to see if it'll be worth having, and I am very happywith my purchase. The vest fits very well, and is easy to put on. When my dog is in the water the handles make it easy to lift him on the boat/kayak/paddle board. My dog super loves it too! After he realized how it helps him swim, he will just swim in circles around us, trying to hand out. Great life jacket! If you're not sure what one to buy, I'd recommend getting this one. For around $20, it's a great deal. Completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent DuMond

customer_reviews.title: Fits well
customer_reviews.text: We bought a medium size and our dog is about 25lb with a thin build. We had to tighten all the buckles as far as they could go, but now it fits really well. We had ordered the small as well, but canceled it because this one fit so I can't compare sizes. It seems well made and sturdy. We love the no-velcro situation. The padding seems comfortable and the handles are great and strong to lift pooch out of the water. All in all I would recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia M.

customer_reviews.title: Nova isn't afraid to swim now.
customer_reviews.text: My Border Collie mix is afraid of the pool, but really wants to get in the water. After watching her flail around in the water, looking terrified, a friend suggested getting her a floatie. She loves it and she is more confident in the pool. I get her the large and it fits well, though the neck doesn't quite fit like I expected. It's fine, though, and I'm very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Terri G

customer_reviews.title: lightweight and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Well made. I just got it yesterday so am letting my puppy get used to it so no pics of her wearing it because she has only had it sit on her. I plan on using this when she comes paddle boarding with me. Bright color and has some reflective binding on it. She won't get all that big as a small Australian Labradoodle so bought the small as it will grow with her once I measured to know what size to get. It appears it will be just right with some room for her to grow still. She is just over 4 months!
customer_reviews.author: lehookedontravel

product_meta.title: Outward Hound Dog Life Jacket
product_meta.description: Size:Large| Color:OrangeOutward Hound's Granby Splash Dog Life Jacket is a high-performance dog flotation device for boating, water sport adventures and activities with dogs. Designed to keep your dog safe while allowing them to enjoy the water. Top dual grab handles provide an easy method of retrieving your dog if an emergency arises while the front float support and adjustable straps keep them secure both in and out of water. Since dogs come in various sizes and body shapes, please select the appropriate life jacket size after taking the girth measurement or the widest part of your dog's rib cage. Make sure to take any other unique traits (large shoulders, long torso, etc.) into consideration. GIrth Measurement Size Chart: XS: 11-15 in (28-39 cm) Small: 16-20 in (40-51 cm) Medium: 21-27 in (52-69 cm) Large: 28-32 in (70-81 cm) XL: 33-44 in (82-112 cm) SAFETY AND CARE: This is a floatation aid intended for use on a conscious dog in calm waters. Use rescue handle to lift dogs in emergencies only. Do not leave dog unattended while using this product. Intended for dog use only.
feature_bullets: SPLASH WITH SAFETY: The Outward Hound Granby Splash Life Jacket is designed with bright colors and reflective accents to provide better visibility while swimming. A front float support helps keep your dog's head above water whether they're a novice or experienced swimmer.

NOVICE & EXPERIENCED SWIMMER FRIENDLY: The Granby Splash dog life jacket is constructed with ripstop material that provides maximum buoyancy in the water, and doesn’t restrict movement on land. Adjustable side release buckles provide a secure fit and a neoprene belly band supports their chest and belly.
MULTI-HANDLE DESIGN: Dual grab handles provide easy access to rescue and restraint dog while swimming or on land.

SIZING BASED ON GIRTH: Dogs come in all shapes and sizes so whether your dog is short and stout or long and lanky, there’s a Granby life jacket fit for them. Available in sizes extra-small to extra-large, we’ve made it easy for you to choose a size that supports them based on their girth measurement.
PLAY IT SAFE: No pet accessory is indestructible. Do not leave with unsupervised pets. Remove and replace if damaged

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
